instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Trackpad doesnt move
threads.message:
Hello Everyboady


I m working on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board its liquid damaged around keyboard. Track pad not moving ( click but not move)

- Tried knows good track pad and flex
- Checked connectors for any corrosion
- Checked <SIGNAL>PP3V3_TPAD_CONN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_CUMULUS</SIGNAL> its ok ( also replaced <RESISTOR>R4808</RESISTOR> and L4807)
- When i didnt connect trackpad fan spins high and other sensor problems but connected working without problem machine so trackpad connecting with machine...

I cant find 18V Boost connection to trackpad at this model where can i check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Trackpad doesnt move
threads.message: Connect a flat cable and measure all pins that connect to <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> from the end of the cable. Could be corroded track or pin.
